overview: From 2025-10-22 to 2025-10-23, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 17 new PRs (12 merged), 5 new issues, and 40 active contributors.

topIssues.title: kurtosis: Ability to use local op-geth build
topIssues.author: sebastianst
topIssues.body:
It would be great to be able to tell kurtosis to use a local op-geth build (e.g. the one linked to in `go.mod`), on-demand building an op-geth Docker image.

Kurtosis currently just uses the optimism-package op-geth pinned version, which is the latest op-geth release. This means we cannot test local op-geth modifications in Kurtosis.

topIssues.title: Rewire interopgen config
topIssues.author: mbaxter
topIssues.body:
## Description

As a follow-up to [this PR](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/17329), we should rework the [interopgen dispute game parameters](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/0cd38ac84359226f6d745992a787e092c3f461af/op-chain-ops/interopgen/deploy.go#L199-L202) passed to DeployImplementations.s.sol to be configurable.  There is some existing configuration for these parameters [here](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/b86c68bea5bd1567278e5bb7e8276785baeeca6a/op-chain-ops/interopgen/deploy.go#L243-L246) that needs to be rewired to work with the new model.

topIssues.title: Add a Sepolia ETH faucet to the Protocol R&D Discord
topIssues.author: alfonso-op
topIssues.body:
### Description

We should have an easy way for protocol developers to request and get Sepolia ETH. Recent feedback from a developer onboarding onto the OP Stack:

> I am trying to setup OP Stack locally, and as per the docs available [here](https://arc.net/l/quote/atlvdmqy), the admin, proposer and batcher addresses require some Sepolia ETH to be sent to them.
> I tried a bunch of faucets but I could only get 0.3-0.4 Sep. ETH (unless I wait until tomorrow)
> Is there a way with which I can quickly accumulate some Sepolia ETH to get unblocked and running with setting up OP stack?
> Normally, how does one go around tackling such situations whenever frequently playing with OP stack (say, during development)?

One nice way to do this is to add a Sepolia ETH faucet to the Optimism Protocol R&D Discord so that those with a role can access it.

The [Espresso Discord Faucet](https://github.com/EspressoSystems/discord-faucet) might be a good starting point, but instructions are sparse.

topIssues.title: Use v2 dispute game contracts in OPCM.updatePrestate
topIssues.author: mbaxter
topIssues.body:
## Description

Use v2 dispute game contracts in OPCM.updatePrestate.  This functionality should be feature-flagged.

topIssues.title: Ensure op-program has passing action tests for Jovian
topIssues.author: pauldowman

topPRs.title: proofs: Migrate SuperFaultDisputeGame to creator pattern
topPRs.author: Inphi
topPRs.body:
This patch only implements the necessary OPCM functions to support the `SuperFaultDisputeGame`  for e2e testing.
Notably, `addGameType`, `updatePrestate`, and `deploy` have yet to be fully migrated to use v2 games. This is OK for the time being since we don't interact with those functions for super dispute games.

part of https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/17972

topPRs.title: op-node/rollup: Drop non-empty batches for Jovian activation block
topPRs.author: sebastianst
topPRs.body:
**Description**

Adds Jovian to the list of forks (before, only Interop) that forbids non-empty batches at the activation block. If the Jovian activation batch contains transactions, it is now dropped.

Also add and improve modular fork handling for the rollup config, which simplified writing the test and adds helpers to more easily write modular tests that work for all forks in the future.

**Tests**

Unit tests added for batch validity checks.

Action/proofs test added to assert that activation batcher with transactions are dropped.

**Additional context**

<!--
Add any other context about the problem you're solving.
-->

**Metadata**

Fixes https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/17704

Interesting historical context, this has already been implemented once at https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/14797

topPRs.title: Update natspec in SaferSafes
topPRs.author: alcueca
topPRs.body: No code changes, but auditors might appreciate it.

topPRs.title: op-deployer: Add upgrade integration test for DEPLOY_V2_DISPUTE_GAME
topPRs.author: Inphi
topPRs.body:
Add tests that cover the op-deployer upgrade flow for the `DEPLOY_V2_DISPUTE_GAME` feature.

fixes https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/17773

topPRs.title: test: Check game args after opcm.updatePrestate for v2 games
topPRs.author: Inphi
topPRs.body:
Updates the `OPContractsManager_UpdatePrestate_Test` test to ensure that disputegame-v2 game parameters are setup correctly when the `DEPLOY_V2_DISPUTE_GAMES` feature flag is enabled.

Once `opcm.addGameType` supports disputegame-v2, we can follow up to remove the `vm.skip` call for that feature flag.

part of: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/17261
